title: Exponential Function with base e - Limit

content.question: The function <math alttext="L"><mi>L</mi></math> is defined by <math alttext="L open parentheses t close parentheses equals a e to the power of negative 0.0149 t end exponent plus b"><mi>L</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>e</mi><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>0.0149</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi></math>, where <math alttext="a"><mi>a</mi></math> and <math alttext="b"><mi>b</mi></math> are positive constants. If <math alttext="L open parentheses 0 close parentheses equals 15"><mi>L</mi><mfenced><mn>0</mn></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>15</mn></math> and <math alttext="limit as t rightwards arrow infinity of L open parentheses t close parentheses equals 1"><munder><mi>lim</mi><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>→</mo><mo>∞</mo></mrow></munder><mi>L</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math>, for what value of <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> is <math alttext="L open parentheses t close parentheses equals 6"><mi>L</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>6</mn></math> ?

topic.text: 2.5: Exponential Function Context and Data Modeling

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Apply numerical results in a given mathematical or applied context.
